page.title: 02 FARMING
page.content: Nearly the whole of our area is devoted to arable farming (with a little pasture land for cows), yet, owing to modern mechanisation, very few are employed in it. The main crops being grown this year are wheat, barley, oil-seed rape, peas and onions. In 1984 Staughton farmer, Mr.G.Peck, won the Toronto Wheat Championship for the World's best hard wheat. A few strawberry fields enable villagers to have a traditional June feast at 60p per pound ! Many people in our survey have shown concern over the nuisance of "cornflies" and of stubble-burning which have plagued us in recent years. Woodlands on the incline to Perry, traditionally open to the public on Good Friday, exist primarily for Game Shooting. Xmas trees are also grown.
